page.title: 08THE PEOPLE
page.content:
The people are divided into two very distinct, but mutually strengthening, groups - the indigenous population and the 'offcumdens' (those who have moved into the area). The indigenous population is of predominantly Angle and Norse stock, borne witness to by both the large number of flaxen headed children and aspects of the local dialect. Many of the families, much interwoven, can trace their ancestry within the Dale for very many generations.
The 'offcumdens' are represented by a large number of retired people or professionals in the sphere of education, the National Park or various service industries. They are, on the whole, warily tolerated by the locals.
